GoalDescription: A stable and prosperous economy, encouraging trade, investment and providing economic opportunities for all members of society throughout Vanuatu
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Ensure financial sector stability and make financial services affordable and accessible for all through pursuing financial inclusion strategies
IndicatorDescription: Total number of new users of financial services annual, acknowledging pop growth (number accounts opening/year)
Concept: Total number of new account open per year is a good indicator of increasing population growth in the country. It also measures to the extent the stability of financial sectors and the affordability and accessibility of their services to everyone. Overall the aim is to ensure A stable and prosperous economy, encouraging trade, investment and providing economic opportunities for all members of society throughout Vanuatu
Definition: Financial services are the economic services provided by the finance industry, which encompasses a broad range of businesses that manage money, including credit unions, banks, credit-card companies, insurance companies, accountancy companies, consumer-finance companies, stock brokerages, investment funds, etc...
Dissaggregation: Gender,  Area Council, Rural/Urban, Province, National
IndicatorShortName: Growth Rate in Users of Financial Services
Rationale: To depict the total number of newly accounts of financial services annually showing the development population growth which leads to financial stability meaning financial services can be affordable and whether or not the accessibility covers all when pursuing financial inclusion strategies.
